page.title: 16SHOPS
page.content: The two main supermarkets in Didcot are Co-op and Keymarkets. Creaks is a small supermarket, but is very popular. Just 3/4 hour after it opened about 250 people had been in! One Christmas they were able to give the staff's children a party with customers' goodwill gifts. Keymarkets have about 80-90 staff. It is open six days a week at present. However Mr Chilburs, the Manager thinks that a year from now all shops will be open seven days. Mr Stones from the Co-op said that, although he did not know the average number of customers per day, they did quite well. Food shopping facilities are sufficient in Didcot, although many people do travel six miles to Tesco in Abingdon. It is noticeable that few people from nearby towns shop in Didcot. There are four main clothes shops. In Notag and Bugsy Malone the most common
